intro: Rubus × recurvicaulis, commonly known as the blackberry dewberry, is a hybrid species within the Rubus genus. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, loamy soils. This species is often found in woodland edges and disturbed areas, showcasing its adaptability to different environments.
